name: Transaction
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Transaction
description:
Transaction

Special Connection instance for running transactions.

See Gcloud::Datastore::Dataset#transaction

examples.caption: Transactional update:
examples.code:
def transfer_funds from_key, to_key, amount
  datastore.transaction do |tx|
    from = tx.find from_key
    from["balance"] -= amount
    to = tx.find to_key
    to["balance"] += amount
    tx.save from, to
  end
end

examples.caption: Retry logic using the transactional update example above:
examples.code:
(1..5).each do |i|
  begin
    return transfer_funds from_key, to_key, amount
  rescue Gcloud::Error => e
    raise e if i == 5
  end
end

examples.caption: Transactional read:
examples.code:
task_list_key = datastore.key "TaskList", "default"
datastore.transaction do |tx|
  task_list = tx.find task_list_key
  query = tx.query("Task").ancestor(task_list)
  tasks_in_list = tx.run query
end

examples.caption: Transactional get or create:
examples.code:
task_key = datastore.key "Task", "sampleTask"

task = nil
datastore.transaction do |tx|
  task = tx.find task_key
  if task.nil?
    task = datastore.entity task_key do |t|
      t["type"] = "Personal"
      t["done"] = false
      t["priority"] = 4
      t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
    end
    tx.save task
  end
end

methods.name: find
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Transaction#find
methods.description: Retrieve an entity by providing key information. The lookup is run within the transaction.

params.name: key_or_kind
params.description: A Key object or kind string value.

methods.name: find_all
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Transaction#find_all
methods.description: Retrieve the entities for the provided keys. The lookup is run within the transaction.

examples.code:
gcloud = Gcloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore
task_key1 = datastore.key "Task", 123456
task_key2 = datastore.key "Task", 987654
tasks = datastore.find_all task_key1, task_key2

params.name: keys
params.description: One or more Key objects to find records for.

methods.name: run
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Transaction#run
methods.description: Retrieve entities specified by a Query. The query is run within the transaction.

examples.code:
query = datastore.query("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
datastore.transaction do |tx|
  tasks = tx.run query
end

examples.caption: Run the query within a namespace with the namespace option:
examples.code:
query = Gcloud::Datastore::Query.new.kind("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
datastore.transaction do |tx|
  tasks = tx.run query, namespace: "ns~todo-project"
end

params.name: query
params.description: The Query object with the search criteria.

params.name: namespace
params.description: The namespace the query is to run within.

methods.name: start
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Transaction#start
methods.description: Begins a transaction. This method is run when a new Transaction is created.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore

task = datastore.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["type"] = "Personal"
  t["done"] = false
  t["priority"] = 4
  t["description"] = "Learn Cloud Datastore"
end

tx = datastore.transaction
begin
  if tx.find(task.key).nil?
    tx.save task
  end
  tx.commit
rescue
  tx.rollback
end

examples.caption: Commit can be passed a block, same as Dataset#commit:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
datastore = gcloud.datastore

tx = datastore.transaction
begin
  tx.commit do |c|
    c.save task1, task2
    c.delete entity1, entity2
  end
rescue
  tx.rollback
end
